intro: Cryptantha hispidula var. euhispidula, commonly known as the hairy cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The variety euhispidula is distinguished by its more densely hairy stems compared to the typical form.
